characters: AT THE END OF THE ALLEY--
DOLLYING THROUGH THE HOLE TO THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WALL,
A BLINDING WHITE-LIGHT SNAPS ON-- WE'RE IN A POLICE LINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We float over a large corporate office, a grid of cubicle slides under us, perfect, symmetrical-- EMPLOYEES working desks, milling in and around the cubicles-- We slide toward the outside walls-- light bathes in from windows, reflections curve off glass-dividers, setting of the nicer offices--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the nicer offices, glassed-in-- at the desk: JOHN HUME, 40's-- tie, shirtsleeves, glasses perched-- company man, polished, not overly-so-- pores over spreadsheets, marking them up-- The spreadsheets-- columns of numbers arc, graceful-- Joh sifts through decimal-chains, crossing out-- shakes his h then: he sees something, a pattern in the chains-- he cir a long rising line-- half smiles-- We see headings: DEATHS, NATURAL; DEATHS, MISHAP; CHILD

dialogues.speaker: FATALITIES
dialogues.text: FATALITY CLAIMS PAID, DENIED-- he circles another chain--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (quietly-- amused) Huh-- there you go-- John looks up-- AMY, his assistant, the EMPLOYEES out on floor, working, joking, all ages, men, women-- happy, bus numbers-- KEVIN-- 30, appears at his door, file in hand--

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Bother you? John-- back at his numbers-- smiles--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Just when you think there's no order anywhere, there's order looking right at you-- Kevin-- not following--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-- right-- John looks at Kevin's file, Kevin brings it-- John scans-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What do you need, here?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Annie said I need you to approve this, no beneficiaries, wife dead-- no kids-- easy-peasy-- John looks up, on easy-peasy-- he doesn’t sign it-- close the file, pushes it-- KEVIN (cont'd) But-- there's no estate-- the lawyer's got dementia--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I saw that. So-- what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (galled) Don't make me file with the state-- for a twenty-five-hundred dollar policy? John bristles-- Kevin sees it--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We file with the state. So one day, in the unlikely event somebody looks back at this guy's death, they'll know we did our job.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (scoops up the file) Oh-- we cover our asses, duh-- got it, sorry--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No-- we do our job. Kevin-- chastised-- John smiles-- JOHN (cont'd) And we cover our asses for when the illegitimate children show up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks ) I didn't see-- illegitimates--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, illegitimate children will leap into being and sue us pantless if you don't give enough of a shit about their dad to put on record that we in the office of life and death made an effort to pay somebody twenty-five hundred bucks in compensation for his passing-- John picks up his spreadsheet again-- smiles at Kevin-- JOHN (cont'd) -- lest he die in vain. OK? (back in his numbers) Might even make some poor bastard feel better. Kevin-- excused-- hesitates, nods at the spreadsheets--

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What's the order-in-the-universe thing? John-- poring over it--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We spent three hundred thousand bucks for these guys to make us this new model, new field-data, new society, who-dies-when-and-how-- but they screwed up all the decimal weights. It's three-hundred thousand bucks worth of dogshit-- Kevin-- following as best he can-- JOHN (cont'd) But even so, it says people with kids live longer than people with no kids, people with two live longer than people with one-- (flipping pages) Smoking is bad-- speeding is bad. Divorce is bad. Deaths in the family are bad. John smiles--  JOHN (cont'd) It's nice to see all that crap's still true. If you have twenty kids, anyway. So you'd better drive home under the speed-limit and get busy with that.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (smiles) I've got my illegitimates. John-- benign teacher-- he’s dismissed--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And aren't they the lucky tykes? Kevin goes-- John, back to his numbers-- he glances up, e catches the PHOTO on his desk-- HELEN, his wife, 30's, beautiful, sharp-eyed, as smart as him, or smarter-- TWO BOYS-- BRENDAN, the older, LUCAS, t younger-- John looks at the picture-- contented--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A prep-school office, rolling fields, fall trees outside- LUCAS, 14-- a couple of years older-- and more pissed-off than in his picture-- sits in front of the dean's desk, waiting-- the dean isn't there-- A WELL-DRESSED WOMAN steps across, putting a file back in cabinet-- she turns, sits at the desk-- It's HELEN-- LUCA

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Of course it isn't fair, but when you screw up, it's embarrassing-- I'm supposed to be a dean--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It's not like I killed somebody.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Telling a teacher to shove it is as close as we get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's a buffoon, Mom, I was quoting-- it was like an ironic shove it.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You want an ironic probation? Lucas doesn't answer-- looks out the window-- KIDS are running track, outside, he watches them loop-- HELEN (cont'd) We haven't even gotten to the home punishment, this is the school-end-- Lucas-- winces-- stares out the window-- she watches him- HELEN (cont'd) So-- what do we do? Lucas-- still looking out: A BUNCH OF OLDER BOYS cuts acr the track, bags, hockey-sticks slung-- BRENDAN, 16, Lucas older brother, with them-- laughing, jocky-- golden-boy--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (still out the window) Anything but community-service.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (smiles, mock-amazed) Luke, that's brilliant-- community service is a great idea-- He rolls his eyes-- HELEN (cont'd) The assisted-living home's having a dance party, they need help-- you know-- Leisure World--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: For the love of God, Mom-- Seizure World?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (smiling-- benign torture) OK-- hockey team needs a laundry boy-- you could help your brother out, support the team-- Lucas looks out, at Brendan and his crew, strutting, goof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the dance of the dead. I can man the diaper-station. Helen-- cheerfully tough-- loving, if he cared to notice- notices-- isn't going to admit it--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Last time, OK? Lucas-- it’s a fair bust-- he smiles, barely, nods-- Hele takes it-- exhales-- HELEN (cont'd) Thank you. Very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDAN-- with other PLAYERS, skating sprints up the ice, COACH WALDREN watching-- Brendan shoots along the ice, guiding the puck like it's glued to his stick, fast-- effortless-- aggressive-- the whistle blows-- everybody stops, except-- Brendan-- He keeps skating-- the coach blows the whistle again-- Brendan spins to a stop, breathing hard, smiling--

dialogues.speaker: COACH WALDREN
dialogues.text: Who wants to start on Saturday, in beautiful Roxbury? They wait-- trick-question-- he looks at his list-- COACH WALDREN (cont'd) (reading off) Larkin, Hume, Tomacek, Whelan-- Brendan-- smiles on 'Hume'-- nods--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice old colonial, rambling kitchen-- HELEN, BRENDAN, LUCAS, at the table, eating--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, because you're a kiss-ass--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (laughs) I got the skills, that's all-- God gave me the skills--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (to Helen) Mom, I need to go kill myself, can I be excused? Helen-- heard it before-- clearing her plate, putting foo from the pots into containers--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Of course you do, Lukey--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I've got a cretin for a brother--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I've got a no-dick for a brother--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (sharply, to Lucas) OK-- you stop, right now-- (to Brendan-- softer) And you should know better. Luke catches the softer voice for Bren-- used to it--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (all innocence, to Helen) What? Helen, back to the leftovers-- shaking her head--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Let's be a family, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (snorts, laughing) Do I get to say no? (bangs the table, yelling) I demand emancipation-- I want a lawyer, I'm filing, right now-- Brendan-- smacks Lucas on the head, not too hard-- Helen- another warning-look--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. HUME’S HOUSE - DRIVEWAY - NIGHT JOHN pulls up-- but the driveway’s blocked by TRASH-CANS- gets out, drags them aside-- glaring at the neighbor's ho

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HUME’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Helen's still looking at the boys, coming off her warning shot-- the front-door bangs closed-- Helen-- smiles despite herself-- JOHN comes in, coat, briefcase-- exhausted--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I missed dinner? Helen-- dumps the containers back into the pots--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: No, there's-- plenty--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (to John) I need a ride to Southie Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Southie?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Roxbury-- it's an exchange game. I'm starting again.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (beaming) That's fantastic-- Waldren loves you, huh? Lucas sees the glow on John-- like Lucas isn't in the roo anymore-—

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, 'cause he's a kiss-ass-- John nods-- he approves, in this case--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, good for him-- we all going? He bumps Helen aside, gently, loads a plate--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's got soccer.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: But I'm not even starting, so--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: You should kiss some more ass. Or not suck so bad-- Lucas flips Brendan the finger-- John bristles, looks at Helen-- Lucas-- knows he went too far-- Brendan-- steps i covers for Lucas-- BRENDAN (cont'd) Come on Dad-- he's kidding-- he's being an idiot-- Lucas-- grateful-- John looks to Helen-- she does this al day--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Brendan-- benign) Don’t call him an idiot-- (to Lucas) Lucas-- you have a loyal and loving brother--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (he smiles) Loyal loving kiss-ass-- Brendan laughs-- John-- tired and hungry--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Let's be civilized, or I'll kill somebody. Fair? Brendan scrunches Lucas by the back of the neck-- Lucas shrugs him off, goes-- Brendan shoves him ahead--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Whatever, weasel--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (mimics, dumb-jock voice) Uhhh, whatever, weasel-- John watches them go, Helen dumps leftovers-- again--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: See what you miss when you don't come home?  10. He nods, smiles--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: They stopped throwing food. She nods-- smiles-- rinsing dishes-- he watches her-- JOHN (cont'd) I can do those. She drops the dish she's holding, grabs a wine-bottle, po two glasses, sits-- day's end--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Lukey told Roger Perle to shove it. They look at each other, dead-serious-- then-- John start laughing-- cracking up-- she does too--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Didn't you tell that guy to shove it last year? She's laughing harder, trying not to-- nodding--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: It was so hard to punish him without laughing--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He's your son alright-- She bursts out laughing, louder, nodding, John too-- she looks to the door, tries to stop-- they fall quiet, final she sips her wine, shakes her head--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Two boys. No justice. He smiles at her-- they look at each other--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROWD of blue-collar and white-collar PARENTS, hooting, yelling-- COACH WALDREN at the benches, intent-- JOHN-- i the stands, watching as-- BRENDAN-- like he was born on the ice, dodges DEFENDERS, drives forward, weaving-- he feints, shoots-- GOAL-- the score clicks up on the board-- the crowd's yelling--  11. John, stamping his feet, clapping, hooting-- he smiles, watching Brendan gliding on the ice, beaming-- He skates away, John watches-- his jersey-- 'HUME' in red letters, big ‘11’-- Brendan shakes his stick high, crowd roars again-- John smiles, shakes his head-- proud-- tickled--

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Late in the day, light waning-- it's a crummy area, proje slum-tenements, wasteland-lots-- far cry from Arlington-- JOHN, driving, BRENDAN, riding, smiling-- good day--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (watching the streets) Some of the guys have been talking about college in Canada--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (driving-- smiles) We're thinking about college? Don't you have another birthday before we think about college?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: ‘Plan for success,' Dad--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (impressed) I said that? That's excellent advice. Brendan doesn't answer-- John watches the road-- JOHN (cont'd) Canada. Canada's-- far--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) You'll still have Lukey.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: There's a comfort-- Brendan winces, protective-- John catches it, smiles--  JOHN (cont'd) You had a very good game today. You've had a few good games. But professional hockey, Bren-- that what we're talking about? Brendan shrugs-- nods-- JOHN (cont'd) -- that's a high-risk business.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: This is from your extensive professional sports background--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: My extensive risk assessment background. Risks-- liabilities-- the stuff of life, son--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Stuff of your life-- exactly--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Don't make fun of your father. Brendan falls silent-- wasted streets slide by-- JOHN (cont'd) Well-- let's look at this-- you have a talent, I don't dispute that. Let's evaluate it, like any asset, see how far you can take it-- in a business-way. Brendan looks at him-- JOHN (cont'd) I can talk to Coach Waldren. We can research schools-- in Canada if we have to-- find somebody who can-- educate us on hockey versus, say-- law-school--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Educate us? Dad, I just want to play some hockey--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (he smiles) I'm saying we can look into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan gets it-- nods-- smiles-- JOHN (cont'd) Just don't tell Mom. Brendan-- grins, laughs-- John rounds a corner, looks ahe stumped-- searching-- JOHN (cont'd) Where the hell's the damn expressway? No signs-- just dark, shabby streets, half-industrial, housing projects beyond-- an alarm pings-- John looks-- a flashing orange gas-pump on the dash-- JOHN (cont'd) Great-—— John looks around the bleak streets-- feels tension, biti then-- he sees the lights of a gas station-- eases, sligh JOHN (cont'd) (goofing, like a general) We may be lost, men, but we'll have gas, by God-- onward to petroleum-- Brendan laughs-- they pull in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN pulls up to the pump, lights from a convenience stor glare-- John looks around-- wary of the neighborhood--

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CAR -
dialogues.text: JOHN gets out, squints at the pump-- BRENDAN gets out too starts for the convenience-store-- John stops--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Need my fluids, Dad-- John looks around-- wary-- but-- no obvious danger--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Ahh-- the obligatory slushy-stop--  14.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: They have 'em in there, right?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That, or something worse for you. You have money? Brendan starts across-- John punches buttons on the pump- JOHN (cont'd) In and out, OK? We have to get home-- Brendan smiles, walking backward, half-way there-- John p the pump in the tank, keeps an eye on Brendan until he disappears inside the store-- we glimpse him, pumping slu John laughs, quiet, shakes his head-- pulls out his phone speed-dials, gets Helen's voice-mail-- JOHN (cont'd) (on cell) Just letting you know your son's gone to Canada to play hockey. We didn't want to drag out goodbyes, so I left him at the airport. He'll call us. If he can. Of course, we may never see him again, but as long as he's happy, right? He pauses-- cars flash by-- a big truck rolls in-- JOHN (cont'd) Home soon. He closes his phone, scans the street-- a strange hush fa a loose sheet of newspaper scuds across the street, twirl upward-- it catches John’s eye, he follows its motion--

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: Behind John-- wheels whining-- cars cornering fast-- John turns, sees: two pimped-out muscle cars rounding the corner, pulling up to the convenience-store-- John’s guard goes up-- his eyes flick to the store, he se BRENDAN-- paying-- sipping the slushy-- John’s eyes flick back to the muscle cars-- he can barely heads inside through black-tint windows-- arms going up-- like they're pulling masks _on-- John’s eyes go wide-- as  15. GANG-BANGERS in black ski-masks burst out of the cars-- g in hand-- charge toward the store-- John-- his eyes widen in fear, shock-- He charges forward, knocks right into the gas-hose, knock loose, it sprays him-- he clambers past, frantic, looking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANGERS burst in-- hold guns at Brendan, the CLERK-- Bren wide-eyed-- as a tall banger-- BILLY DARLEY-- the leader, scoops cash out-- the clerk reaches for an alarm, Billy swings his gun and shoots him in the chest-- then, same instant, smacks a scrawny banger-- JOE, his little brothe on the back of the head, hard--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (smacking the scrawny one) Do it, you faggot--

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE -
dialogues.text: JOHN-- running forward blindly, eyes on Brendan-- a car pulling in to pumps clips him, knocks him to the concrete he scrambles up, another car pulls out, barely misses crushing his head as he stumbles, runs-- as:

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE -
dialogues.text: JOE-- jittery-- scared-- eyes in his mask full of fear, h Brendan-- staring-- terrified-- BILLY (cont'd) Do it-- (grins, at Brendan-- yells) Ready, kid? You ready? John-- running-- hears Billy yell-- rushes up as: Joe-- like mean liquid, turns-- walks to Brendan, snake-f = pulls a LONG MACHETE from his jacket-- and slashes the blade up, across Brendan's throat-- gashing it open--

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE--
dialogues.text: JOHN-- sees-- in horror-- as:  16. Brendan-- stares-- staggers out, toward John-- falls thro the door-- drops--

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE -
dialogues.text: JOHN-- charges toward Brendan-- BRENDAN-- throat _open-- lying on the concrete-- blinking gasping-- JOE-- stares down at Brendan-- amazed, or terrified, at t sight-- what he's done to him-- BILLY and the other BANGERS charge through the door, scat except: Joe-- he sees John-- hesitates-- machete in hand- Joe-- runs for the street-- passes near him-- John lurche tries to grab him-- he gets him by the throat, throws him down-- he drops his machete-- John gets his mask off-- se his face-- as-- The BANGERS stop-- look back at John and Joe-- Heco start for Joe, to help, Billy holds him back-- smiles, not yet- lets Joe struggle-- JOHN-- smacks Joe into the concrete-- trying to get free get to Brendan-- Joe swipes at him-- John bangs him down- JOE-- finally-- gets his weight out from under John, flip up, throwing John down on the concrete, smashing John’s h against it-- John falters, almost blacking-- Joe jumps up jumps over John-- runs for the cars, but-- Billy jumps in-- engines ripping, cars shoots backward-- Joe runs to them but the cars peels out without him-- Joe runs out into the street, looks back at John-- And is smacked by a pick-up truck-- spun by impact, Joe sprawls on black-top, out cold-- traffic stops, horns hon John-- on the concrete, barely conscious, blood drips in eyes-- he blinks it away-- Brendan's motionless-- white-- John crawls to him-- fadin takes Brendan’s body in his arms, screaming--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (screaming) Help-- help me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see into the two muscle-car speeding away, racing, sid side-- the bangers peel off their masks, we glimpse: BILL 20's, Boston Irish-trash, hard as cross-nails-- BODIE, bl hard-timed, hard-eyed-- HECO, Salvadoran, silver bead on lower lip, chin jutting-- BAGGY, Cuban, head shaved-- SPI and JAMIE, Irish-trash, DOG and TOMMY, black, jailhouse-m all pumped-- whooping-- Bodie looks back--

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: Where’s your brother?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (laughs-- callous) He's a man now-- he can take the subway-- They cackle-- speed away, whooping--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burst of activity-- Brendan wheeled into the ER, JOHN, agonized, trots by Brendan’s side as ORDERLIES rush him i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow motion without sound: looking down a hospital corridor, we see a distraught HELEN and LUCAS run up to J The ER DOCTOR approaches, talks to them-- we can’t hear-- Helen collapses into John, sobbing, shaking-- John holds tears well out of him but he doesn’t break down, his face stone-- Lucas, stunned, left-out-- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- bandaged-- staring through one-way glass-- a group Irish-trash STREET-RATS squint in the glaring light-- JOE among them, under a big ‘6'--  18. John stares at Joe-- runty-- malevolent-- in a dead-dream DETECTIVE WALLIS, 50's-- waits-- John breathes--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Six. Number six.

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: (nods) Joe Darley.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He's a-- kid--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: He's a runt, almost twenty. And he's an animal. John stares at Joe, a trapped rat-- hate boiling up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleak. Raining. Cold. The HUMES watch as their first-born is lowered into the ground-- John watches the casket-- no tears-- he’s far from Luke, from Helen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty, silent kitchen-- we hear the front door close, off JOHN, in a funeral-suit, comes in, turned to stone, dry-e HELEN and LUCAS-- shell-shocked, follow-- none of them se to know why they've gone in there-- Helen begins to cry, leans back against a counter, suppre the tears-- she looks to John-- but he's locked-in-- sile Lucas-- sits at the table, looks at both John and Helen-- neither of them seems to notice him--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I'll make some eggs. Helen-- doesn't answer-- John drapes his jacket on a chai goes to the fridge, gets eggs out, starts making them--  19. Helen watches him-- sits next to Lucas-- they sit in sile as John scrambles the eggs-- finally-- Helen looks down at her black dress-- picks at it.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I should probably change. She looks to John for a response, there isn't any-- she g up, goes-- finally Lucas gets up--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (to John) I guess I'll change too. Nobody answers Luke-- John whisks the eggs-- Lucas watche him a moment-- and goes--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (quietly-- after Lucas is gone) OK. John looks up, sees Luke's gone-- he stands there, stirri the eggs-- Suddenly-- he slams the pan across the stove, eggs splatt out, burn on the flame-- He stares at the mess-- grabs a towel, cleans it up-- sta a new batch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN and HELEN, in bed, in the dark, unable to sleep--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: They said there's a-- pre-trial hearing tomorrow, they want me to go. Make a statement or something. Do-- you want to go with me? She stares-- fighting pain--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You go. Put that-- animal in jail.  20.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That's what the cop called him, an animal-- John-- trying to make order-- JOHN (cont'd) Some kind of-- mad dog. Helen stares into the dark-- she takes a breath--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: The school said they wanted to do a memorial-- at the next game. The team wanted to do something. John-- it's cold comfort.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That's-- nice of them.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (she nods) He would have been playing. Helen closes her eyes-- reaches for John’s hand-- he take it, she squeezes it, as hard as she can, crying, softly, trying not to-- weary of crying-- John holds her hand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS-- in bed, awake-- staring too-- He gets out of bed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS comes into Brendan's room-- stands in the doorway, staring at it-- posters, his bed, books, his hockey-stuff He stays, a moment-- lays his hand on the bed-stead-- goe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hears LUCAS walk by their door, back to his room-- h hears Luke's door close again-- he doesn't move--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN, on his way to court-- sees empty TRASH-BARRELS righ behind his car, blocking the way-- he looks across to:

dialogues.speaker: THE NEIGHBORING HOUSE
dialogues.text: BAKER, the neighbor, rushing back, obviously the culprit- glares at John-- righteous, annoyed--

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: (yells over) You're supposed to take them in-- John glares-- drags the barrels aside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS-- staring at his desk as MR. PERLE, 40's, drones, b

dialogues.speaker: MR. PERLE
dialogues.text: -- there may not be much actual justice, but if the code said ‘an eye for an eye' carved right into a big stone slab, they could say, look, it's in writing-- Lucas-- rubbing his knuckles on the desk, distracted-- MR. PERLE (cont'd) (in bg) -- don't riot, don't rebel, keep Slaving in the pyramids, watch hieroglyphic cable'-- Lucas rubs harder, the skin opens, starts to bleed-- A GIRL next to him sees-- he looks at his hand-- surprise HENNING-- a 'friend,' callow-- snickers-- Perle looks bac  22. MR. PERLE (cont'd) My friend Mr. Hume-- (not without sympathy) Joining us today? Luke sits up-- picks up his pen-- HENNING looks, ridiculi

dialogues.speaker: HENNING
dialogues.text: Chill, Humey-- Lucas stares-- seething--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN, trying to work, looks out-- the HOCKEY TEAM, stick their shoulders, all very like Brendan-- she looks at her files-- and gently but firmly shoves them off the desk--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- with MICHAEL BARING, ASSISTANT DA, 40's-- with som JUNIOR DA's, and DETECTIVE WALLIS--

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: Today's easy-- John looks at Baring-- it isn't easy for him-- BARING (cont'd) I need you to sit there, put the fear of God in this guy-- if the judge asks you to, you tell him what you told us, and identify Darley in court-- John, nods-- BARING (cont'd) The minute I get your statement in, with you sitting right there, the public defender's going to wet his pants and fold, I'll make a deal in five minutes, get this guy in jail today-- easy-peasy-- John-- stares at Baring--  23.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about? What deal? I want this guy in jail-- for the rest of his life--

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: No-- I can get you three-to-five, guaranteed-- that's a very decent result in the-- John-- outraged--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He killed my son-- Baring-- blinks-- sympathetic, but-- overwhelmed--

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: Guaranteed time-- not maybe, not the jury didn't feel up to it-- that's worth more than chasing a make-believe ten-to-life and the guy walks free-- you want that? John-- furious-- ready to jump out of his chair--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You aren't using my son's death for a card-trick-- do you understand? Baring-- wishes it were otherwise--

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: Mr. Hume-- this is what my office is willing to do. I'm fighting a pattern here, initiation killings are just part of it, I get a banger off the street a year or so, somebody does my job for me, he never comes out alive, fine with me, he finds Jesus, fine with me-- John-- missing something--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What do you mean-- initiation killing? JI thought it was a robbery-- Wallis shrugs-- uncomfortable--  24.

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: It just looked like one. It was an initiation-- you kill someone at random, to get made in a gang. It's the-- price of admission.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You're saying my son was murdered so some asshole could feel like a man? So he could be in some club? Wallis-- Baring-- look at John-- he stares, numbly-- stun JOHN (cont'd) There's-- no sense to that-- John-- shock slips to-- rage-- growing second by second-- Baring-- sorry, but:

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: This is a take it or leave it thing, Mr. Hume. Sorry to say. John-- stares at Baring--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- on the stand-- he looks at: JOE and his public defender, WILSEY, 30's suit, pony-tail-- BARING standing-

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I'd like to enter the statement of a witness present at the attack-- father of the victim-- The judge glances at John-- at the clock--

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE GOULD
dialogues.text: We can enter that at trial, can we not, Mr. Baring?

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: I believe your honor, if we enter the statement today, defense will change their plea to guilty and save the people the time and expense of a trial-- The judge looks at John again-- John’s staring at Joe-- t judge waves Baring to the bench--  25.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE GOULD
dialogues.text: That's the statement? Baring brings John's statement, the judge looks at it-- John's still looking at Joe-- JUDGE GOULD (cont'd) Mr. Hume, you're giving evidence that Mr. Darley here, before your eyes, attacked your son and caused his death? You’re saying you'll testify to that in a trial? John-- staring straight at Joe--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No sir. I am not.

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: What? John looks at Baring-- Joe's starting to smile--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: There were a lot of them. It was dark. I can't be sure any more. Baring-- furious-- Joe-- grinning like a coyote-- John st at him--

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE GOULD
dialogues.text: Do you expect to obtain evidence other than Mr. Hume's here? Baring-- dead-ended--

dialogues.speaker: BARING
dialogues.text: No your Honor. I do not. The judge-- skeptical-- but nowhere to go--

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE GOULD
dialogues.text: I'm dismissing this case-- I humbly note you might have been better off taking your chances with a jury, Mr. Baring-- John stares at Joe as the judge talks-- JUDGE GOULD (cont'd) (to Joe) You are released from custody.  26. You may return with a bailiff to the holding cells to retrieve your personal effects. Joe gets up-- struts out, right by John, smiling-- John watches him go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winds blowing-- colder weather moving in-- JOE-- carrying a plastic bag of personal effects-- talkin his cell, laughing-- hunching in his jacket from the cold ACROSS THE STREET -— JOHN-- in his car, staring at Joe-- eyes burning into him Joe sits on a bus-stop bench-back, waiting-- John watches him-- glances in his rear-view-- Brendan's g bag, his hockey stick-- still in the back seat-- he looks it, a moment-- then looks ahead as: The muscle cars pull up-- BILLY the others, pile out, laughing, smacking Joe around, he laughs-- they do a sort leering cheer, roasting him--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (we just hear, from across) You fucked that up pretty good, huh? Who's aman, now? Joe laughs-- all cocky, now--

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: That fucker was sitting in a pool of pee, man-- that’s right I’m walking, pucker the fuck up-- John-- seething-- stares at their faces-- Billy-- Bodie, Heco, all of them-- he knows who they are-- JOE-- gets in they pull away-- John watches the muscle cars go-- he hesitates-- breathin hard-- and starts his car-- follows--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- following the cars-- deeper and deeper into the Southie war-zone-- he catches glimpses of JOE, through th window-- The neighborhood turns darker, more ragged-- closer to th part of town where Brendan was killed-- John follows, watches-- finally-- they pull up, JOE gets Billy and the others are grinning--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIRL-- waiting on the step of the decrepit project buil she pulls a little vial out of her pocket, shakes it, grinning-- BILLY and the others shove him forward, laughi

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Have a nice time, weasel-- Billy smiles-- goes to her-- she and Joe kiss as the cars pull away-- JOHN-- parked up the street-- watching-- She pulls Joe’s keys out of pants for him-- they go in-- door of the building closes behind Joe-- John stares at the door-- leans his head on the steering wheel, lost-- no idea what to do-- He sits up, gripping the wheel with all his might-- start the car, finally-- pulls away--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls up-- jumps out of the car-- starts looking aro the garage-- he scans the tools hanging on the walls-- He picks up a weeding spade, grabs it-- puts it down agai he opens a locker-- an axe-- he hefts it-- not right, dro it-- He reaches up to a top shelf-- straining-- pulling down a dusty plastic tool-tub-- riffling through, loudly--  28. LUCAS has come out-- he stands at the door, watching John

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hey-- John stops, briefly-- then--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (searching again) Hey-- Lucas keeps watching him--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What are you doing? John pulls out a large scythe-- hefts it--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Nothing-- son-- John scans the garage for another weapon-- he drops the scythe back in, we see: a half-rusted old hunting-knife-- dirty, dull-- but deadly enough-- John takes it in his ha Lucas watches John, not seeing what’s in John’s hands-- h picks up a box-cutter from the tool-bench, fiddles with i John sees-- JOHN (cont'd) Don’t play with that-- put it down-- Lucas puts it back-- thinking--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: So-- it was like a gas-station? John stops-- agitated-- LUCAS (cont'd) Where Bren got killed-- John-- thrown-- on edge-- covering--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yes. It was a gas-station-- (he hesitates) Why do you want to know? Lucas doesn’t know himself-- trying to make sense of it--  29.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I wondered where he died. John-- not what he wants to talk about now-- but--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (as gently as he can) It was a-- Kwik-Stop. In Roxbury. John-- scans around again, still searching-- on edge-- st holding the knife--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (nods ) Do you think he was scared? John can barely stand it-- he nods-- looks at the knife i his hand--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (gently-- near-cracking) Yes. I think he probably was scared, Lucas. The headlights of an approaching car, hit them-- HELEN, arriving home from work-- John drops the knife through th open window of his car, on to the seat-- out of sight-- Helen gets out-- she comes closer--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: How did it go? John hesitates-- gathers his courage--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: They let him go. Her eyes widen-- she stares at him-- so does Lucas-- Hele can't believe it--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: They did what? Why? John-- dying-- lying--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don't think it was him. Helen-- disbelieving-- Lucas too--  30.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: But-- you said it was him-- you said they had him-- John doesn’t answer Helen-- staring incredulously-- undon HELEN (cont'd) Are they going to keep looking?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (lying again) They said they would. She keeps staring at him-- bereft-- JOHN (cont'd) (quietly) I'm sorry. John-- still agitated, still covering-- he heads for his JOHN (cont'd) I think I left something I need at the office-- I’d-- better go back--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Now? Jesus, John-- John bursting-- gets into his car--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I'll be home as soon as I can-- John drives off-- leaving Helen and Lucas standing there- Helen turns-- storms past Lucas into the house, smashing aside the partially opened door-- Lucas stands there, alo he looks at the box-cutter-- pockets it-- goes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- parked up the block from the building Joe disappea into-- watching-- forcing himself to take measured breath A YOUNG MOM, pretty, latina, rounds the corner, rushing, strapped to her, stroller loaded with grocery bags-- she crosses, hurries into her building-- John watches another moment-- then shakes his head-- blow out air-- he reaches for the key, about to turn it--  31. He stops, suddenly-- doesn't turn the key-- the building is opening-- John watches-- JOE steps out, carrying a bag of trash, smoking a cigaret heading or the alley-- John's eyes widen-- he watches Joe walk toward him-- Joe-- stuffs his free hand in his pocket, against the col sucks on the cig-- John-- hyper-ventilating, gasping, trying to stay calm-- looks across the sidewalk, through shadows-- the trash-al John gets out of the car-- no idea what he's doing, but h doing it-- Joe half-slips on the sidewalk-- dogshit on his shoes, he starts scraping it--

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Jesus-- christ-- John pulls his collar up, goes into the alley-- Joe scrap the dogshit off, pays no attention to John-- Joe-- walks on-- nearing the alley-- JOHN-- steps out, in front of him-- Joe looks up-- doesn' recognize him at first-- then he does-- fear flickers-- they're alone-- John-- enraged-- terrified-- Joe-- laughs at John-- JOE (cont'd) You're kidding me-- Joe holds the trash out to drop it, but before he can, Jo lunges forward, grabs Joe by the jacket-- the trash drops Joe stumbles backward over it-- John drags him with all h might toward the alley-- Joe, shocked by the force John is dragging him with-- tri to wrestle out of his grip-- John-- drags Joe backwards into the alley-- light of stre receding-- Joe’s panting, fighting-- surprised, afraid of John now-- John-- huffing-- grunting-- dragging Joe further and furt back into the dark, cinder-blocks, over trash, no matter much Joe kicks and twists and claws-- Joe can't get leverage, John keeps dragging him--  32. John finally slams Joe to the ground, slams Joe into the concrete again and again and again-- Joe grabs at John's throat, John pulls back, slams Joe again-- Joe-- grabs at John's coat, yanks him sideways trying to over him-- John loses his balance, slips down-- The knife falls out of John's coat, bounces-- Joe and John both see it-- both lunge for it-- Joe gets i first, gets over John, kicks him down, jumps up, pulls th knife out-- hops back, wielding it-- John-- on his knees-- looks up at Joe-- the blade-- Joe swoops in at him, swiping the blade at John-- John charges at him-- slams Joe back into the wall-- grab the knife-hand, holds it as tight as he can, trying to contain it-- tries to pin Joe with his body-- his elbow pressing his head down-- They're locked on the ground, breathing, gasping, deadloc John pinning him-- Joe choking John-- strangling him-- John shifts one hand, starts to edge the handle out of Jo fingers, slowly-- Joe’s wriggling, but can't budge John-- John gets the blade free, yanks his throat back away from Joe, and suddenly swoops the blade into Joe's gut-- a sav blow, it shocks John-- and Joe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe gasps-- rattles-- and stops-- silent--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares in shock-- staggers backward, drops the blade he turns away, falls on all fours, guts wrenching-- He vomits-- sweat beads over him, he rolls back away from pool of sick-- stares at Joe's body-- amazed--

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE ALLEY--
dialogues.text: In upper windows, curtains part-- NEIGHBORS looking out-- John claws backward, into the shadows-- the curtains clos again-- no yelling-- no sirens-- quiet-- He scrambles to his car-- and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN pulls up in his car-- he steps out-- and hurls his k into the water-- it splashes, disappears-- he goes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN, on the living-room floor, piles of video-tapes aro her, a big basket-- she’s sorting, manic-- LUCAS, near he the floor, sorting through too-- staring at old video-tap an old family video, a town New Year's Eve party, plays, Helen looks at Lucas, no idea what to say to him-- she tr

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (sorting-- keeping busy) I’ve been meaning to do this for-- months-- it’s very-- grown-up of you to help-- She catches herself, knows she came off patronizing-- Luk keeps sorting through-- a big laugh, roar, on the tape on tv-- JOHN, HELEN, BRENDAN, LUCAS laughing-- goofing-- HELEN (cont'd) (taken-- touched) What a bunch of knuckleheads-- Luke watches-- doesn't answer-- the front door bangs shut they both look up-- JOHN walks in-- smeared with mud, sweat, his coat torn-up Helen sees, jumps up-- HELEN (cont'd) Jesus-- what the hell happened to you? John sits in a chair, heavily-- he looks down at himself-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I-- slipped-- at the station. It was icy-- Helen-- staring--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ--  34. Lucas studies John-- Helen-- starts pulling his coat off, fussing over him-- HELEN (cont'd) My God, look at you-- He looks at her-- his face is open-- almost at peace-- He notices it-- warms to it--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m going to-- get in the shower--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I’1l bring you something to eat-- John gets up-- some kind of relieved trance, a weight lif he sees Lucas staring at him--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: How are you doing. You OK? Lucas nods, barely-- welcomes the connection, brief or no on video, in bg: the countdown starts, bg-- 10-9-8--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I'm OK. I guess. John nods-- lays his hand on Lucas' head, scruffs-- first time he's touched him since Brendan died, Helen catches i Lucas looks at John, their eyes meet-- John nods-- the cr counts down: 7-6-5--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Good. That’s good. John goes-- Lucas, warmed briefly, sinks cold again-- in on video-- 3-2-1--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands in the shower with his head hung, water washi away pain-- guilt-- and the front he’s kept up-- Overwhelmed, he breaks down-- slides down the wall into a foetal position, crying for his son-- naked, vulnerable-- HELEN comes in-- sees him--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: John--  35. She rushes to him, turns off the water, kneels, embraces John, shaking-- crying with grief-- relief--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I'm-- sorry-- I'm so sorry-- She tightens her hold on him-- begins to cry with him.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Oh, John-- shh-- shh-- They’re together now, for the first time since Brendan di They hold each other, squeezing the pain away, as best th can-- Helen, part-relieved-- at least John's with her, no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN, heading for work, comes out as BAKER, the neighbor, leaving the trash-barrels behind John's car again-- John-- throws his briefcase down-- starts marching across lawn at Baker-- Baker blanches-- starts backing away-- sees the look on John's face-- homicidal--

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: (backing away) Uh-- I'm only-- John storms after him, grabs him by the shirt-- gives a h shake, neck-snapping-- Baker's gasping, terrified--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You want to clean something up? You want to? Baker-- spluttering--

dialogues.speaker: BAKER
dialogues.text: Jesus-- Christ-- John-- drags Baker across toward Baker's trash-barrels-- through grass and flower-beds, mud-- Baker can't get free BAKER (cont'd) Let me go-- Jesus--  36. John-- shoves him with all his might into Baker's barrels Baker falls backwards, slips, skins his elbows-- John stands over him-- points a finger in his face--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (quiet-- deadly) If I see you on my lawn again, I'll kill you. OK? That OK with you? Baker-- stunned-- nods-- John walks away, amazed-- that felt qgood--

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR -
dialogues.text: HELEN and LUCAS-- on the front porch, heading out-- they’ been watching-- John straightens his tie, clears his thro JOHN (cont'd) Sorry guys-- (lying through his teeth) I, uh-- I shouldn’t have done that. He gets in his car, pulls out-- they watch him go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A body-shop office, half in shadow-- BILLY comes in, duffel in hand, heads for the back-- we h

dialogues.speaker: BONES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where the fuck you been, Nancy? Billy stops dead, turns and sees-- hidden in shadow-- BONES-- 40's-- black-Irish, black-heart, heavy as death-- behind the counter, locking away his prized possessions-- array of guns, laid out-- Billy tosses the duffel-- it lands near the guns-- BONES (cont'd) Watch the pieces. They’re worth something-- unlike you-- Billy, slow-blinks-- Bones looks in the bag-- angrier--  37. BONES (cont'd) What the fuck you call this?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: That's our night. Bones-- pops a gun-slide-- chambers a round-- pops the ro out again-- looks at Billy--

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: When I take pity on you and your faggot half-wit friends, give you a couple of corners to run-- (raises his voice, just) You better deliver, or I'll know you're stealing from me. And I'll kill you. Bones stands up-- Billy flinches-- barely. BONES (cont'd) You can be the prince of Pa-Yan, you're light-bagging me, I'll kill you. Good? Billy-- shrugs as much as he dares-- nods-- full of hate-

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (quiet-- just as deadly) Good. Bones-- scoops the cash out of the bag-- throws the empty at Billy’s feet-- turns back to his guns--

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Lord knows I've been patient-- (still not looking up) Yes, you can get out of my sight, now. Billy-- full of hate-- grabs the bag and heads out the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy storms out of the body shop-- couple of YARD-DOGS, chained, low-growling, behind him-- he heads for his car- A car screeches up, cuts him off-- BODIE jumps out-- Bill guard up--  38.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: You hear? Your brother, dude-- Bodie-- doesn’t know how else to say it-- BODIE (cont'd) Somebody stuck him. He’s dead. Billy-- shocked-- burning--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What? You're lyin’-- Bodie’s not lying-- Billy looks back at Bones' shop-- and marches to his car--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- at his desk-- devouring a sandwich-- cranking thro his numbers again, swift-- sharp-- MARSHALL, 50's, John's boss-- stops at his door, sees Joh zipping through-- John looks up--

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: You're doing a huge job for us with this thing of yours--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well-- work helps-- Marshall-- sympathetic--

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: How are you guys faring? You-- getting through it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We're ok. You find compensations. It's what we do, right? We compensate for loss-- move on-- Marshall-- taken aback-- John seems almost too recovered-

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: If anything like that ever happened to me I think I'd-- snap--  39.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (covering) You really don't know what you'll do. Until it happens. You-- surprise yourself-- WALLIS appears in the doorway-- John tenses-- on guard--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to break in on your day--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (tense) No, that’s-- (he stops) Marshall-- this is the detective-- for Brendan’s-- John can’t quite say ‘murder’-- he waits--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: That guy we thought killed your son. Somebody killed him. John-- on edge-- waiting for Wallis to accuse him--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (covering) What was it-- some kind of-- gang thing?

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: (nods) We think so. John eases, relieved-- he’s getting away with it--

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Jesus-- there is justice, huh? John looks at Marshall-- Wallis-- blinks--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I suppose there is. Wallis-- sympathetic-- or suspicious-- both--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: I thought you’d like to know. I thought that might mean something to you. If he was the one, I mean.  40.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (quiet-- covering) Thank you. Wallis glances at John’s work, spread across his desk--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: I’ll leave you to it, then-- Wallis goes-- Marshall steps to the door too--

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Me too-- I'm here when you need me-- Counseling, anything-- John buries a smile-- half-haunted--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We’1ll-- manage-- Marshall leaves-- John sits back-- breathes-- looks out t window, a shining day, blue sky, white clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS-- other PLAYERS, leaving the field after soccer-- sweaty, muddy-- played to the death-- HENNING-- taunting-

dialogues.speaker: HENNING
dialogues.text: Jesus, Hume, you're like a blind- man, three guys open and you take a nap on the ball-- Lucas-- ignoring him-- Henning-- knows he shouldn't, but- HENNING (cont'd) I'm sick of losing 'cause you have your head up your ass about your damn brother-- Lucas wheels-- punches Henning in the face, Henning drops Lucas jumps on him, punching, brutally-- he can't stop-- KIDS try to pull him off-- Henning cowers, tries to get h hands up-- Lucas punches through them-- over and over--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (punching and punching) Shut up-- shut up, you prick--  41. Lucas-- punching-- savage, rage boiling out of him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN-- with LUCAS-- her heart breaking for him, but does know where to start-- cold silence--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Can we get to the punishing now?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (clears her throat) Certainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole-and-corner river-rat bar-- BILLY, BODIE at a booth, with HECO, BAGGY, JAMIE, SPINK, and TOMMY-- beer and whiskey, silence--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I'd like to find the motherfucker who did that to him-- They nod--

dialogues.speaker: SPINK
dialogues.text: I'd take a piece of that.

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: Me too. He was a good boy. Billy-- waiting--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: So? Who the fuck was it?

dialogues.speaker: BAGGY
dialogues.text: Wasn't MS-13-- I'd know about it. Billy stares at him-- BAGGY (cont'd) I'd know, OK? They look to Bodie--  Silence-- 42.

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: Wasn't B-Street, wasn't the Hall. Wasn't any of those assholes, none that's bragging on it, anyway-- nobody's saying shit, nobody was over there, anyway. It's bullshit--

dialogues.speaker: BAGGY
dialogues.text: My sister said she saw some fucker in a suit down there--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: How many fuckers in suits you ever see in Dover Hall? Billy gets up, goes to the bar-- AT THE BAR -— Billy passes SAM, the bartender, goes to a stack of newspapers scattered at the end, riffs through-- he stops headline, about Brendan's death-- Sam watches-- “ARLINGTON YOUTH SLAIN IN ROXBURY" Billy comes back to the table--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: There's a comical thing-- we never make the papers when one of us gets killed-- (reading) Son of a senior vice-president of Boston-based Aurora Life Insurance-- Billy throws the paper on the table-- looks at them-- They nod, BILLY (cont'd) We sentence this motherfucker. He's done breathing. real as death--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCAS, on his bed, holds the box-cutter over his wrist-- starts cutting-- stops-- punches the blade into his arm-- throws it across the room, punches the wall, raging-- He gets up-- grabs the box-cutter, his back-pack-- walks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- with a few other LATE-WORKERS-- comes out of his building, edges the square, heading for the 'T' train-- He sees a POLICE-CAR cruising, seems to slow down as it passes-- he flinches, reflex-- it keeps going-- so does h We see a blur-- somebody darting into a doorway-- John lo behind him-- nobody but a few last late commuters--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN, a few COMMUTERS board the train-- we catch flashes- somebody looks like SPINK-- somebody looks like HECO-- Jo looks down the cars-- no sign of them, if they were there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN, riding-- the car deserted-- the train pulls to a st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN gets off-- deserted platform, old cast-iron station- looks around again-- wary-- heads for the stairs-- BILLY-- steps out of a tunnel, behind John-- gun in hand- strides up behind John, gun aimed at John's head-- John s him, dives downward, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy shoots-- misses John-- John whirls, running, lookin back-- Billy shoots again, John flinches, cowers, stumble backwards on to the stairs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks-- TOMMY, SPINK, DOG, BODIE, JAMIE, BAGGY, HECO-- rushing forward-- he sees their faces-- recognizes them, remembers them circling Brendan-- Billy shoots again-- it pings on the metal stairs-—- John clambers up the lower steps-- runs up the metal staircase-- Billy shoots after him again--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY-- runs up onto the bridge from the stairs-- no sign John-- Billy whirls-- as-- JOHN-- jumps out of an archway, smashes Billy in the face with his elbow, grabs Billy by the forearms, shoves him backward, all his might-- Billy digs his heels in, his ar bangs a pillar, he drops his gun, it clatters-- John, too scared to let go, swings Billy-- keeps shoving Billy backwards toward another set of stairs-- Billy-- back-wheels, fighting it, but-- John shoves him, his might, he falls down the stairs-- he smacks the metal stairs halfway down, bleeding-- Dog yells:

dialogues.speaker: DOG
dialogues.text: Billy-- John looks at Billy-- he knows his name now-- looks at DO TOMMY-- the OTHERS-- guns up and blazing, charging at Joh John-- dives, cowers-- sprints for the other end of the bridge for other stairs-- BULLETS PINGING AROUND HIM, concrete popping, wired-glass shattering-- John stumbles at the top--

dialogues.speaker: ON THE METAL STAIRCASE--
dialogues.text: He somersaults down, head, elbows, smacking--  45. He rolls out, at the bottom, runs to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- runs for his life across the footbridge-- just as TOMMY crests the stairs at the other end-- John dodges ar the corner into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN runs in-- bolts for a row of cars across the concret diving behind one-- cowering, peeking out-- BILLY runs in, gun up-- scanning-- John-- scrabbles sidew behind the car-- he looks up-- a FIRE-EXTINGUISHER on the wall-- he starts to crawl toward it-- sets off a car-alar he scrabbles away, frantic-- BODIE-- all the OTHERS- swarmed into the lot now-- start shooting at the car sounding the alarm, riddle the car, t wall, with bullets-- John’s surrounded-- he looks at the stairway-- looks at t extinguisher-- he crouches and bangs car after car after in a row, staying behind them, as alarm after alarm sets BILLY and the others fire and fire, only glimpsing John between cars, clouds of concrete busting out as bullets s and alarms go off-- John finally gets to the extinguisher, yanks it off the w metal squeaks, it’s deafening, even among the alarms-- he holds it in front of his head, charges straight for the stairs-- JAMIE is in his path, John roundhouses the extinguisher around, smashes Jamie in the face-- and keeps running for stairs-- shots pepper the wall-- he throws the extinguish behind him, bullets pop into it, explode it-- John runs-- smashes a fire-alarm as he goes into the stairwell-- emergency-lights flash on, blinding-- Billy a the others, squint, shooting wild-- sprinklers shower dow Billy, the others-- John runs up the stairs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- frantic, running-- shots smacking the walls below he passes one level, keeps going up to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN runs straight for another row of car-- crouches, crawling along-- watching the stairs-- BILLY and the othe run by-- Billy hesitates-- looks down the stairs, other levels-- he nods to Tommy--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: In there-- Tommy runs in, Billy and the others charge up-- JOHN crawls along behind cars-- tracking as TOMMY runs in John-- sees his car-- Tommy's right next to it-- John tak his keys-- beeps the locks-- Tommy spins, looks at the ca John charges him from behind-- grabs him, wheels him, doi anything to keep him from turning around and getting his or his hands on him-- he smack-wheels him into a concrete pillar, Tommy bounces, his gun spins away-- John scrambles for his car-- gets the door open-- as Tomm rushes him from behind, grabs John, strangling-- John-- his head inside-- Tommy pulling him out, to kill h John sees, in the back-seat, Bren’s hockey-stick-- he gra it, shoves it backward with all his might into Tommy’s fa Tommy reels back, John jumps out, holds the hockey stick across Tommy’s throat-- Tommy struggles, John squeezes do the stick snaps in two-- John spins it and stabs it against Tommy’s chest, it hits bone, barely sinks in-- but Tommy’s pinned, gasping-- bleeding-- Tommy reaches his gun, on the concrete, starts spraying bullets, but he can’t get the gun to point at Jo car-windows, windshields shatter, more alarms--—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY and the others hear-- Billy and Bodie look at each other-- run back--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy finally beats John backward, John falls, with the hockey stick-- rushes to the nearest car, windows’ smashe yanks the door, trying to slide through to the other side before Tommy can shoot-- TOMMY jumps after him-- dives on him in the car-- they wrestle, death-lock-- John starts to get out of Tommy’s grip-- desperate-- he s the hockey-stick deep into his throat-- it sinks in-- Tom gasps-- splutters-- but still clabbers with his hands, tr to wring John’s neck--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brake-lever pops up, as they fight-- the car starts rolling backward, down the slope-- they're going together closer to a thin metal-rail-- John fights, madly-- closer Tommy, spluttering-- fights as hard-- The car rolls back faster and faster-- they're almost at edge-- John-- still holding Tommy he kicks the windshield, all h might-- 1--2-- 3 times-- it pops-- he bangs his elbow dow into Tommy's face, gets loose-- he wraps the seatbelt aro Tommy’s neck, around the gear-stick-- he scrambles out, slides over the hood: Tommy-- wedged inside, caught in the seat-belt--

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STAIRS--
dialogues.text: BILLY and the others run in-- as Tommy, trapped in the ca smashes through the railing-- Billy and the others stare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car-- Tommy in it-- smashes through, dead-drops a hun feet, and-- smashes at the bottom, the entire front collapses, Tommy's crushed-- dead--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- frantic, desperate, jumping his car, starting it-- screeches out of there, leaves Billy and the others stand they wheel, look at him, he races away-- Billy stares-- furious-- he sees something on the ground- peers closer-- it’s John's wallet, he dropped it-- Billy picks it up-- looks inside-- smiles--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John-- driving-- panting-- haunted-- he careens around tu after turn, getting out of there, he can't seem to slow d he looks in his rearview, again and again-- nobody seems be following-- he keeps looking, in fear for his life-- His cell rings-- he jumps-- looks, it's Helen-- he answer looks at his watch--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (trying to sound half normal) Hi-- I'm sorry I’m late, I-- (he stops) What do you mean, you can't find him? Did you call his friends? John-- a chill goes through him-- JOHN (cont'd) Jesus-- honey-- I’11 call you back-- I think I know where he is-- He throws the phone at the seat-- fish-tails the car arou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John driving, fast, anxious-- it's the street where Brend was killed-- the same gas-station-- he looks ahead: John’s eyes widen-- LUCAS-- in the distance-- standing on spot where Brendan died-- John pulls up-- jumps out-- looking around-- LUCAS-- hand his pockets-- shivering-- staring at the ground-- JOHN runs to him-- Lucas looks up--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (furious-- yelling) What the hell are you doing? Your mother's terrified-- Lucas blinks-- John-- wary-- he barks-- pointing-- JOHN (cont'd) Get in the car-- Lucas-- staring to cry-- backs away--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: No--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I_ said get in the car--

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I don't want to get in the car-- John-- had enough-- he marches over, grabs Lucas-- picks up-- Lucas writhes, fighting John-- kicking-- punching-- gets out of John's grip-- collapses to the concrete, sobb LUCAS (cont'd) (screams ) Fuck you-- John stops, on guard-- fearful for Lucas--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: This isn't a safe place.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know that much, don't I? John-- can’t answer him--  50. LUCAS (cont'd) Would it have been better if it was me? Is that what it is? You guys could have handled that a lot easier than losing Bren the golden- boy-- John-- stares at him-- Lucas finally has his attention--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Jesus-- son-- John grabs Lucas, hugs him-- looks in his eyes-- JOHN (cont'd) I swear to you, son-- that isn't true. I love you. I swear to you-- Lucas-- breaks down, sobbing-- John helps him up, still o guard-- JOHN (cont'd) (quietly) Come on. Let's get you home. They walk toward the car-- John watching, on guard, every step--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HUME’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT JOHN and LUCAS come in-- HELEN rushes to them, wraps her around Lucas, holding him for dear life-- John stands by, almost an outsider, then wraps his arms around both of th

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (quietly) It'll be better-- I promise you-- Helen looks up at him-- JOHN (cont'd) We'll be a family again. Soon. -- but he has no idea how-- he looks out-- holding them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheap store-front, fake-wood panelling, plastic chairs, counter with bars-- more like a bail-bonder than a funera home-- BODIE, the OTHERS stand by the counter waiting-- silent-- furious-- BILLY-- his back to them, stares out to the street, hard nails-- tapping John's wallet on the door-- A CLERK comes back to the counter with some forms, cranks numbers on old paper-tape calculator-- looks at Bodie--

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Memorial service is only another hundred-- Billy looks at the clerk from the door-- as if he’d like kill him--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (calls over) He doesn't need a service. Just burn him. The clerk hesitates-- Bodie leans in-- threatening--

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: How about we respect the bereaved's wishes or I'm burning you too-- The clerk punches the calculator-- it rattles out tape--

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Cremation and disposal. Seven- hundred. Billy pulls John's wallet open-- walks to the counter-- f out two bills--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You see this wallet? This wallet’s got two hundred. And this two hundred takes care of my brother. Billy stares at the clerk-- daring him to argue-- the cle throat creaks, a scared little cough--  52.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (he nods) Two hundred. (clears his throat) We’re-- sorry for your loss-- Billy turns for the door-- he stops, looks at the body-ba a gurney, next to the counter-- Joe's body-- he looks at bag-- then he looks at the wallet, walks out-- they follo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY-- still carrying John’s wallet-- comes out with the OTHERS-- Billy locks eyes with: BONES-- sliding by in his sedan-- staring at them, seriou a hanging-- Billy, the rest tighten-- fear shows-- Bones pulls up, hard, steps out-- crosses to them, a scrunched-up newspaper in his fist--

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: What are we doing here? Huh? Billy eyeballs him-- the others somewhere between backing Billy and fearing Bones-- nobody answers-- BONES (cont'd) -- maybe somebody’s going to tell me when you girls are planning to put in a few minutes on the perfectly good corner I gave you? He slaps Bodie in the face with the newspaper, Bodie flar doesn't budge-- BONES (cont'd) And now I get to read all about gang-wars and dead pieces of shit because somebody had to go kill a rich little faggot. Way to make the papers-- I don’t need help like that-- They look at him-- hating him-- but more afraid of him-- Bones-- steps closer, like death himself-- BONES (cont'd) Listen to me, kids. You work for me, you work for me.  53. You don't in-and-out, you don't half-ass, you pay me. J say when you're done, and when I say that, one of you leaves the shit-hole you live in after your morning needle one pretty day and wakes up bleeding to death in the trunk of my car, OK? ‘Cause when you're with me I'm your life and death. I'm the world on a cracker. He stares at them-- BONES (cont'd) So which one of you boys going to bleed to death in my trunk? (in Billy’s eyes) Huh? You, Billy boy? Gang-lord? Bones snorts, derisive-- BONES (cont'd) Whatever you little fucks think is important ain't important. So stop it. Right fucking now. (paternal, good-coach) You're all good boys. Now buckle down for me. He turns-- starts walking away-- Billy looks at the funer home-- sees a little plume of brown-gray smoke, billowing

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (calls after him) They're burning Joe-- if you're interested-- Bones nods, walking-- tenses, barely, but-- not intereste

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: (walking away-- sing-song) He'll be the lucky one, boys-- Billy-- watches Bones go-- madder-- burning-- he looks at John's wallet in his hand-- throws it to Bodie, it slaps his chest, he catches--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HUME’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - MORNING John getting dressed, looks on the dresser, pats his hip- pocket-- his wallet’s missing-- he goes to the closet, pa the suit he was wearing yesterday-- not there either--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls up into the parking garage-- COPS, YELLOW TAPE everywhere-- he keeps going to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cops on this floor-- John parks, goes to the edge, loo down-- a crane is lifting the smashed car up-- MORE COPS everywhere, STATION OFFICIALS-- Tommy's body is covered u with a white sheet-- He looks down around the wreck-- sees WALLIS-- he scans t ground for any sign of his wallet-- none-- Wallis looks up, at the broken guard-rail-- John pulls ba out of sight-- breathing hard-- He looks across to the tracks-- COPS there, too-- he’s driving to work today-- he goes back to his car-- pulls o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN drives by the broken railing, the COPS-- scans the ground as he goes-- no sign of his wallet-- he drives on-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALLIS-- looking at the smashed car-- the evidence-bag of bullet-casings-- thinking-- he watches the bloody hockey- stick going into a bag--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JOHN’S OFFICE - DAY John-- agitated-- tries to focus on his project, his numb he can’t-- he slams the spreadsheet down, gets up-- paces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BODIE-- crosses the lobby of John’s office building-- carrying a package-- He looks at the directory-- heads for the elevator-- a GU at the desk sees him--

dialogues.speaker: DESK GUARD
dialogues.text: You need to sign in-- Bodie looks at the guard-- DESK GUARD (cont'd) Messengers drop off over there-- The guard points the other way to a messenger center, oth MESSENGERS dropping off-- another GUARD-- armed-- nearby-

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: No-- I need to hand-deliver this-- to John Hume-- The armed guard glances at Bodie-- looks him over--

dialogues.speaker: ARMED GUARD
dialogues.text: You can sign in and drop it off like everyone else. Bodie looks at the elevators-- the guard’s defenses up-- Ding-- the elevator door opens-- Bodie waits-- as the elevator door closes, he runs for it--

dialogues.speaker: ARMED GUARD/ DESK GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey! The armed guard chases after Bodie, but the door shuts be he gets there-- he runs to an adjoining elevator. The desk guard rolls his eyes-- picks up the phone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JOHN’S OFFICE - DAY John-- trying to focus-- hears yelling, outside-- he look up, sees: BODIE-- zig-zagging through the cubicles, knocking into people and furniture-- trailed by four SECURITY GUARDS--

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: (yelling) John Hume-- John Hume-- John sees Bodie-- he gets up, goes to his door-- Bodie sp John-- heads straight for him, comes up face to face-- BODIE (cont'd) Nice office. Motherfucker. John-- seething with anger--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What the hell do you want? Bodie hands John the box--

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: That’s the gift of freedom, baby-- The guards grab Bodie-- Bodie eye-balls John-- the lead G looks at John-- thrown, they seem to know each other--

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Sir? Should we escort this person out? John-- doesn’t answer-- Bodie grins-- GUARD (cont'd) (to John) Sir?

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: (staring at John) You’re free from wondering how you’re going to die, now. (he smiles) You’re free from wondering if you’re going to die alone. Hear? Bodie laughs-- deadly-- low-laughs--  57. BODIE (cont'd) (sings-- low-- deadly) -- ‘cause you'll get pie, in the sky, when you die-- John stares-- Bodie snaps the guards’ hold off him, fast snake, and walks away-- the guards try to hustle him, he shakes them off again-- keeps walking-- MARSHALL-- KEVIN-- AMY-- and everyone else in the office staring at John-- John takes the box inside, sets it on his desk like it’s going to explode in his face-- he stares at it, tension growing-- he lifts the lid-- revealing: His wallet-- John lifts the wallet out-- opens it-- riffling through i stopping at a picture of him and his family-- He pulls the photo out-- its smeared in blood-- John’s ey wide, in horror-- something catches his eye-- Reflected in the shiny surface of his desk-lamp-- the bac the photo-- a phone-number, backwards-- he turns the phot around-- He stares at the phone-- he picks up, dials the number-- breath harder than the last--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move through a dark corridor, lit only by a red, overhanging lamp, to a ringing pay-phone. A hand picks up-- it’s Billy-- but he doesn't say anythin he smiles, waits, breathes, loud enough for John to hear-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Where are you, you bastard? Billy smiles, waits-- let’s John twist--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Family's everything, eh? Isn't it? It is to me.  58.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Oh, I see, you'd do me down like you did my brother. He was a kid you know, once. Did you know?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (yells-- furious) Like my son?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: We had birthdays, we had all that. You had a few for your boy? Cake? Singing? John-- too enraged-- too gut-twisted to answer-- BILLY (cont'd) Well-- you and your little loves-- see? John waits-- bursting-- Billy-- calm as death-- BILLY (cont'd) You_just bought yourselves a death sentence. All of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy hangs up-- dial tone-- John-- in a panic--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Don't hang up-- god damn you-- John-- hyperventilating-- everyone’s staring-- he yanks o his desk drawer, spilling papers, a stapler-- digs-- as h dials, frantic--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN'’s desk-- her phone rings-- she’s not there-- John-- frantic-- listening to the rings--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Damn it-- Helen comes in, looks for something, letting the phone ri she finally picks up--  59. JOHN (cont'd) Jesus, honey are you OK? Is Luke

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: Helen-- frightened--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Yes-- we’re-—

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: -- stay there-- keep Luke there-- don't go home, alright?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: John? What’s happened?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Just stay there until somebody comes-- promise me-- She’s thrown-- terrified--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Who? Who's coming?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: The police-- She goes cold--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: John? What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Just stay there until the police come-- then go home, I'm coming home-- alright? He hangs up-- he’s still digging through-- he finds Walli card-- grabs it-- and runs out--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. JOHN’S BUILDING - ELEVATORS - DAY JOHN runs to the elevators, chasing Bodie-- bangs the but can’t wait-- he runs for the stairs-- charges through the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JOHN’S BUILDING - LOBBY - DAY JOHN runs through the lobby-- crowds of PEOPLE-- no Bodie he runs out to--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. STREET OUTSIDE JOHN’S OFFICE - DAY JOHN runs out-- crowds, cars-- no sign of Bodie-- he’s go he sees a UNIFORM COP, moving a double-parked truck along he looks at the cop-- He peers at Wallis’ card, hesitates-- then dials his cell frantic-- as he’s running for his car-- He runs, frantic-- gets in his car as an operator picks u

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (on cell) I need Detective Wallis-- now--

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Hold--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT./EXT. JOHN’S CAR - DAY JOHN-- starts up, yanks the wheel, pulls out into traffic

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (yells-- jamming the wheel) No-- I need to talk to him right now-— Cars screech, horns blast at him, he peels through-- Operator hesitates-- John-- panting, breathless, desperat

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: I’m putting you through--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. WALLIS’ OFFICE - DAY WALLIS, typing-- the phone rings--  61.
JOHN-- driving like a banshee-- careening through gaps--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: They've threatened my family-- Wallis-- catching up--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: Mr. Hume?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Those trash threatened to kill my family--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: (takes control-- working) OK-- where are your family right now?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: They’re at the school-- St. Bartholomew-- John-- panting-- barrels through a red light--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: Now-- what trash are threatening your family? Why would they want to do that, Mr. Hume? John-- panting--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Just-- help us-- please--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: I will. John throws his phone aside-- jams the accelerator, jets to the expressway-- Wallis-- line dead-- gets up, grabs his jacket--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. OUTSIDE HUME’S HOUSE - DAY JOHN pulls up, still driving like a maniac-- the COP CAR there, TWO COPS inside-- John runs inside--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HUME’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY LUCAS and HELEN are at the table-- frightened--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What the hell is happening? He looks at her-- looks to the cop-car outside-- he can’t answer her-- he starts running through, locking doors, windows, closing blinds-- Helen watches-- fear mounting-- John heads to the living-room--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. LIVING-ROOM —- DAY JOHN-- rushes through, locking windows, dropping blinds-- stops-- all he can do-- HELEN comes in-- stares at him-- The doorbell rings-- John tenses, looks-- as WALLIS peers in through the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John goes to the door, opens it-- Wallis comes in-- John leads him toward the living room--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Thank God you’re here-- Wallis looks at John-- weighing--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. LIVING-ROOM —- DAY JOHN and WALLIS come in--  63. Wallis looks at the living-room, sees an alcove bristling with Brendan’s hockey trophies-- medals-- bronze pucks-- pair of crossed hockey-sticks--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: Your son was a hockey player. John-- thrown-- Wallis nods-- WALLIS (cont'd) The car’ll stay here tonight-- (keeps staring) I think it’s time you told me-- who did what to who?
