John doesn’t answer-- Helen stares at John-- Wallis-- ang WALLIS (cont'd) You make war on the wrong dog? That what you did? You figured you could just go kill some little asshole because you live out here? Helen stares at John, at Wallis, horrified--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What are you saying? (to John) What is he saying, John? John-- twisting-- he lies-- miserable-- desperate--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’ve done nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: How about you tell me how you get Billy Darley this pissed off at you? Huh? John-- cuts him off-- Helen is staring at him--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Billy? Billy's Darley’s brother? Wallis-- nods, guarded-- JOHN (cont'd) He's the one who made Joe Darley kill my son? He's the one who runs these animals? Wallis-- hardens--  64.

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Mr. Hume. Just get through tonight. And Thank God you're alive this long. But if you started a war, God help you. Wallis-- snorts-- WALLIS (cont'd) I meet a lot of killers say the same damn thing. Helen looks at John-- breaking in two-- Wallis goes out i the hall-- Helen stares at John-- doesn’t dare ask him-- but:

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What have you done? John looks at her-- he can’t say it-- but he doesn’t have Helen realizes, she half-collapses in shock, fear, leans against the couch-- staring at him-- John looks away from her-- and follows Wallis out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN comes out after Wallis-- Wallis stops--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: How do I stop this?

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: Did you start it? John-- says nothing-- but his eyes admit it-- Wallis nodd weighing-- John’s waiting for him to arrest him--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don't care what happens to me. But I need them safe-- how do I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallis looks at John-- weighing--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: (nods to the squad car) Do everything those guys tell you.  65. (starts out) You might pray, too. Wallis goes-- Helen comes out-- stares at him, in shock-- fear-- he looks away again-- locks the door--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT./EXT. PATROL-CAR - IN FRONT OF HUME’S HOUSE - NIGHT All’s quiet-- wind rustles the trees, the house is dark-- The COPS sit, waiting, silent-- the one in driver’s seat takes a last drag on his cigarette-- hits the button to l his window, just a couple of inches, tosses the cig out-- The blade of a machete-- slides through the gap, drives r into the cop's throat-- he gasps, twists, tries to reach blade it goes deeper, he goes limp-- the OTHER cop tries pull his gun-- the passenger door opens behind him, he's grabbed from behind, yanked backwards-- he tries to reach radio but a blade rips across, opens his throat-- he gurg slumps--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. JOHN & HELEN’S ROOM - NIGHT HELEN-- sleeping, fitful-- wind blows outside-- curtains lift, blown by drafts-- the window rattles in the old fra JOHN-- wide-awake-- on guard, on edge-- looks at the wind almost frozen with fear-- He gets up, goes to the window, jams it tighter, the ratt stops-—- He looks out-- the POLICE CAR, still there, under the streetlight-- he just makes out the driver COP’S uniforme elbow, resting against the driver-side window-- branches in the wind-- John looks up and down the street-- not a soul in sight-- He hears a thump-- downstairs-- can't tell what it is-- h looks at Helen-- reaches under the bed-- the scythe, from garage-- he takes it-- goes out to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HUME’S HOUSE - HALL OUTSIDE LUCAS’ ROOM - NIGHT JOHN looks in on LUCAS-- he’s sleeping-- wind blows outsi Lucas’ window rattles too-- John looks behind him, into t hall, spooked suddenly-- some shadow, moving-- nothing th He looks up and down the hall-- another thump-- a creak-- can’t tell if its the wind, or what-- his blood chills-- He looks at Lucas’ door, at Helen’s-- he goes to the end the hall, looks out that window, sees--— THE COP CAR-- from another angle now-- reflections of blo branches slide over the windshield, he can’t see inside-- then-- as the trees blow harder the reflection shifts, he sees inside: THE COPS-- dead-- throats cut-- JOHN'S EYES GO WIDE-- he spins-- as: BILLY, BODIE and the OTHERS charge up the stairs, straigh him-- shooting-- swarming at him-- plaster, glass, explod John flinches as glass splatters his face, the gun-flashe are blinding-- he drops his scythe as a bullet pops his t open, red bursts out across the wall-- He half-drops, grabs the scythe-- he darts his eyes to Lu and Helen's doors-- but Bodie and the others are charging already, swarming right, left, screaming-- John bolts up, his scythe raised, eyeballing Billy, who's standing in the center of the hall, smiling at him-- John charges-- him as-- HELEN-- with Heco dragging her by the hair-- is dragged o screaming-- John rushes toward her but HECO rushes in, smashes John in the face-- John drops, struggles to get u But they are dragging Helen away-- LUCAS, dragged by SPIN is half-thrown out into the hall, Lucas smashes against t wall-- John’s eyes meet Lucas’-- they look at each other- John charges up again-- Spink laughs, looking at John, as Heco smashes John down again-- and drags Lucas away as He grabs John by the throat, grinds his boot into John’s wou leg-- John looks-- as Helen and Lucas are dragged away from him down the stairs-- helpless-- Heco pokes him in the temple with a gun, laughing-- starts to drag John along too--  67.

dialogues.speaker: HECO
dialogues.text: (laughing) Come on and kiss my ass while we watch them dying-- John explodes-- twists out of Heco’s grip-- gets the gun from him-- fumbles trying to get a shot, but Heco kicks J in the face-- John drops the gun-- but he’s out of Heco’s grip, he scrambles along the floor, charges for the stairs-- Heco shoots after him, plaster bursts from the wall-- John disappears down the stairs-- Heco chases him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN-- crying hysterically, on her knees, Lucas, bleedin looking with hate in his eyes-- BILLY and the OTHERS-- looking at them, guns raised-- JOHN bursts in-- yells--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN-- LUKE--
dialogues.text: They turn-- their eyes meet John’s-- John rushes at Billy the others, straight into their guns, putting his body between the bullets and his family--

dialogues.speaker: BAGGY
dialogues.text: (whoops, looks to Billy) Let's get it done! Billy nods-- he and the others open fire, gunflashes everywhere, walls, porcelain, exploding-- John wades stra at them, going for Billy-- John’s hit in the side but-- he keeps going for Billy-- HELEN is hit in the chest-- blood bursts, she falls-- Luc is hit in the face, then the shoulder, he drops, spinning John turns-- sees Helen and Lucas falling, dead-- Billy smiles, looks at John-- shoots him in the back-- John’s b spins-- then: Billy takes aim at John’s head-- fires-- it grazes his head, slices through his scalp, but his head s back, bleeding as if head-shot-- he drops--  68. Silence-- no more guns-- Billy and the others look at Hel Lucas, John, a wounded heap on the floor-- Billy looks at John, takes a step closer-- sirens wailing, closer--

dialogues.speaker: BODIE
dialogues.text: Come on. He's dead. Billy turns-- we follow their boots, walking out, over debris, over the bodies of John and his family-- we hear smashing, crashing, off-screen, as Billy and the others casually rash the place as they go, tipping over shelves, laughing-- finally they’re gone, silence presses in-- HELEN-- dead-- LUCAS-- dead-- JOHN-- dead-still-- lifeless, but-- we go closer-- closer We hear the smallest, merest rasping breath pass from his seemingly dead lips-- he’s still breathing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN in a hospital-bed-- hair shorn where the bullet graz his head-- raging, drugged, half-conscious, tearing at tu wires-- screaming with loss-- horror-- guilt-- ORDERLIES rush in, past the UNIFORM COP outside, the cop rushes in too, they try to subdue John-- John fights them slides off to the floor, fighting-- finally they gang up, hold him down-- inject him-- he yells out, louder-- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN's eyes open-- blinding lights-- he’s in bed, bandage the horror of the memory floods him-- an ORDERLY hangs a bag on his I-V-- the monitor beeps, softly, John’s heart- seems to hate the sound of it--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Can we turn that off? The orderly-- half-afraid of the look on John’s face-- tr a joke--

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: The monitor or your heart?  69. John-- no answer-- ORDERLY (cont'd) I’ll ask the doctor. John stares-- the orderly goes, past the COP on guard jus outside-- as: WALLIS comes up the hall, comes in-- looks at John-- the patch on his head where the bullet snaked through his sca

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: You know, my Dad was on the job thirty years, got shot twice, missed his organs, hail-mary’s-- clean-through’s, just like you. “They keep missing me” he said. Then he takes another one, five years before pension. Went into his guts, he bled to death, slowly though, took a week. My Mom and I came every day. WALLIS (cont'd) You know what he said to me before he died? “It’s the last one that gets you.” Funny, huh? John-- doesn’t answer-- WALLIS (cont'd) You’re done. Understand? Wallis nods at the guard-- WALLIS (cont'd) You think he’s here protecting you? He’s here to haul your ass to jail if I say so. I got a DA doesn’t want to put you away, thinks he’1l lose votes, thinks you’re going to look like a hero. You don’t look like a hero to me. Wallis blinks-- WALLIS (cont'd) This thing stops right now. God knows why you’re alive but you’re getting a second chance. Don’t fuck it up. John-- doesn’t seem to care if he lives or dies--  70.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m going home. Wallis doesn’t buy it-- shakes his head--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: You’re going home when I tell you to. You’re going home when I believe you. John-- struggling-- breaks off-- he can’t go on-- he clos his eyes-- fighting tears down--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I killed my family. JI killed them. Wallis looks at him-- half-comfort, but half-damning-- is going to let him off--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry you lost your family. But we’ll find those fuckers and we'll bring them to justice.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: If there was justice my family would still be here.

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: And where’s your retribution gotten you? John-- no answer-- WALLIS (cont'd) Everybody’s right in a war, aren’t they? Everybody's doing the right thing. John looks at him-- WALLIS (cont'd) Well, all of them end up dead. You were never going to win this thing. You’re not going to win it now. John-- looks at him-- pain shifting, hardening again-- to anger-- Wallis stares at him-- and walks out-- John watches him g looks at the cop-- then: John looks at the closet, sees his clothes--  71. He sees his wallet, keys, and cell-phone in a plastic tra a table-- he pulls himself up-- gathers his strength, get out of bed-- He goes to the table, opens his wallet-- the picture, wit the number on the back-- He coughs-- leans on the table-- picks up his cell-- powe it-- it works-- he dials--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (on cell) Kevin-- I need you to run a number-- 555-9815-- yeah-- (waits-- he sags) -- nothing? Look somewhere else. Get it for me. He hangs up-- gets his clothes, starts getting dressed--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HOSPITAL - HALL OUTSIDE JOHN’S ROOM - DAY JOHN-- dressed-- comes out-- the COP goes on guard--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Am I under arrest?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: You’re not going anywhere, I can tell you that much--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (in his eyes) Do you have kids? The cop nods-- barely-- JOHN (cont'd) I had kids. I had a wife. John looks as if his soul has died-- the cop can see his heart breaking-- it affects him-- JOHN (cont'd) And now I want to go home. The cop-- affected-- but-- wary-- JOHN (cont'd) Let _me go home.  72. The cop-- wants to do it, but-- can’t-- he pulls on his r mic-- sees the look in John’s eyes--

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Sorry, buddy-- you don’t get to go home right now-- John-- ready to explode-- Something snaps inside John-- the cop looks at him-- COP (cont'd) (on radio) -- 2-3, 2-3-- I'm gonna need-- He stops talking-- because his night-stick just got jamme into his gut-- he bends over-- John’s holding the club-- cop reaches for it, and John swipes it across his head, knocks him cold-- John looks up and down the hall-- nobody saw-- he drags t cop through the door--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (quiet-- dragging him) Yes I do. Sorry-- buddy--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. HUME’S HOUSE - NIGHT Raining-- bleak-- JOHN walks toward his door-- police-tape everywhere-- he stops, his eyes dead-looking-- he rips the police tape as goes inside--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HUME’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT JOHN-- alone-- raining, bleak-- the horror of what's happ pressing in on him-- he can barely stand it-- He stands, staring-- smashed debris-- he looks through to kitchen, and can’t quite stand it-- but he goes through t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN comes in-- looks at the floor where Helen and Lucas fell, debris everywhere-- crime-scene tape-- grief floodi over him-- He sinks back against a window-ledge-- he turns, looks ou at the pouring rain-- torrential, whipping-- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next morning-- WAL-MART- the gun-counter-- mild-looking C helping an OLD MAN with an automatic-- John walks up, doesn’t wait--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (loudly) I_want a gun. Now. The clerk-- busy-- thrown--

dialogues.speaker: GUN-CLERK
dialogues.text: Be right-- with you-- John looks at the wall-- shotguns-- pistols-- he points--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I want two of those and two of those-- The clerk and the old man stare-- John looks like a mad-m wide-eyed--

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Well-- you can-- start with the forms there-- (nervous ) There’s a-- three-day wait--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I can't wait three days-- understand? I need them-- John stops-- aware he’s masking a scene-- The clerk picks up the phone, as if he’s going to need to call security--  74. John turns, walks out-- he walks past: a wall of machetes looks at them-- keeps going--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, in his car, dead-ended, at a loss-- tears start come, he fights them down-- His phone rings-- he answers--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah-- It’s Kevin--

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (on phone) I got that number run-- it’s a bar in Southie-- the Four Roses-- what’s the-- John-- he breathes-- cuts him off--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Goodbye, Kevin. He hangs up--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ARLINGTON - MASS FEDERATED BANK — DAY JOHN at a teller-window-- the TELLER is counting out huge stacks of cash-- looking at John-- the look on his face--

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: (counting-- on edge) Do-- you want bags for this? John-- nods his head-- she keeps counting, still on edge- she hesitates-- TELLER (cont'd) And you said the savings too? John-- nods--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Everything. All of it.  75.

dialogues.speaker: TELLER
dialogues.text: Pulling out the college fund, huh? John-- bites down-- doesn’t answer-- she keeps counting-- eyeing him-- nervous-- TELLER (cont'd) And do you want a-- guard-escort? To your car? John laughs, barely-- breathes out-- he stands there like ghost-walker-- waiting--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (quiet) No. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN comes in, a duffel-bag in hand-- it’s dark, deserted except for a HARD-TIMER, a DOCK-RAT, drinking his pay, an SAM, the bartender-- loading cases off the bar-- John walks to the bar--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m looking for Billy Darley. Or any of his friends. Sam-- appraising-- John's looking almost like a local-- haggard-- his face battered-- he goes on loading-- nods t the door--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: They’re outside that door somewhere. So get the hell out. John-- pulls out a wad of cash-- slaps it on the bar-- th bartender hesitates-- sneers-- SAM (cont'd) You get a popper through your ear, might help you hear a little better, yeah? That what you want? John lunges across the counter, grabs Sam by the shirt, s his face down, bangs it on the counter-- the hard-timer g his blood up, climbs off his stool, starts walking at Joh  76. SAM (cont'd) (struggling) Fuck you-- fuck you-- Sam-- feels his cheek where John bashed it down-- the har timer comes at John-- grabs him by the back of the head w his free hand, bounces him off the bar-- the guy drops, d to the world-- Just as the DOCK-RAT rushes up--

dialogues.speaker: DOCK-RAT
dialogues.text: Hey-- piss-ant-- back it up-- John-- still holding Sam down, doesn’t know what else to he swings his elbow with all his might into the dock-rat’ face-- The dock-rat falters, and John kicks his feet out from un him, he goes over backwards-- stumbles up-- John looks at the dock-rat-- blinks-- and-- John bashes Sam's head down again--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (yells) Get the hell off me-- John-- shakes him-- growling--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Tell me where to find Billy Darley-- tell _me-- Sam-- a little gash on his cheekbone-- blinking-- John sc more money out, practically shoves it in Sam’s face--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You don’t want Billy Darley, buddy-- John-- bangs him again--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Where is he? John slaps another wad out with his free hand-- bangs Sam again-- JOHN (cont'd) I've got business with him--  77. Sam looks at the small mountain of cash inches from his f he gives, finally--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: OK-- let me go, OK? Let me go-- John eases off-- Sam straightens up-- starts shovelling c SAM (cont'd) (he nods) His boy Heco’s crashing in 113, up the block. Top back. John nods-- still staring-- SAM (cont'd) (mimes a syringe poking his arm-- smiles) He’s usually hooking up around dinner-time, you know? OK? John-- nods-- he hesitates-- slaps another wad of cash on bar--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And I need to buy some guns. Sam-- wary-- what’s he done-- but then he looks at the mo and shovels it up--

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: LaVallete and Forge-- only thing over there. Guy named Bones. John nods-- heads for the door-- SAM (cont'd) Don’t let his little friends eat you-- John-- hesitates-- goes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN walks to the gate-- sees the pair of yard-dogs, at r low-growling-- John moves past them, cautious-- He heads for the office--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN comes in-- wary-- sees BONES, half-obscured in shado sitting on the cheap metal chair like Satan on his throne counting cash into a metal box-- metal baseball bat in vi on the counter-- gun under a ledge, beyond that-- Bones's head comes up, wary-- stops counting-- eyes John, weighing--

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: Help you? John-- cautious-- stony--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I need guns. Bones hardens-- squints-- his eyes are animal-- John catc something-- ferocity-- John's own fear--

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: I don't know you. Bones-- his eyes flick to the baseball-bat-- then to the John catches it-- tightens--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I came from the Four Roses. John turns-- looks at the dogs, outside, low-growling-- B follows John with his eyes-- watchful-- meaner by the bea

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: I’m going to guess you’re a little bit far from home. John opens the duffel-- shows Bones the cash-- Bones looks at it-- nods-- pulls a key from under the counter, unlocks a steel wall-cabinet-- John stares-- every kind of gun you can imagine, bigger, shinier, deadlier than anything Billy or his gang have ha BONES (cont'd) (handling each, showing off, popping actions)  79. You got your Colt Python-- that’s a sweetie got your Smith and Wesson -45, that’s a hungry-man-sized friend-- got your Desert Eagle-- king of mayhem, take this to the holy-land, do your own crusade-- (to John-- heavy) Any one of these’1ll get it done. John scans the guns-- bewildered-- in a strange country--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (nods to the Python and the Smith and Wesson) Those-- and-- John looks behind-- to a double-barreled breech shotgun-- JOHN (cont'd) That-- Bones pulls it down-- looks at the neat stack--

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: That’s three fucking grand worth of killing. You got three grand worth of killing to do? John doesn’t answer-- his face says it all-- he counts ou the cash-- Bones lays up cartridges for him-- and some be holsters-- BONES (cont'd) I’m going to comp you some accessories, ‘cause you got a thing about you-- Bones looks at him-- a death-look, almost smiles-- John blinks it away-- starts loading the guns into his bag-- BONES (cont'd) You got a killing thing about you, you surely do-- Bones starts to laugh-- John doesn’t answer-- shoves the belts, the bullets into the bag-- John zips it-- starts out for the door-- he feels Bones e on him-- Bones, watching him, looks at the gun under the ledge, but then-- lifts a big automatic down, the Desert Eagle, half a foot long-- he loads it-- John hears the ‘click’-- hesitates, keeps going--  80. BONES (cont'd) You the motherfucker after my son Billy? John stops dead-- turns, looks at Bones-- he gets it--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Billy? Bones stares at John-- malignant-- a deadly look, more de than anything John's seen in Billy or the others-- John’s hand twitches on the handle of the bag-- looks Bon dead in the eye-- swallows hard-- and says it: JOHN (cont'd) Yes. I’m after your son.

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: Well, he's no damn doing of mine. And anything he did's no damn doing of mine. OK? Bones-- sets his gun on the counter-- in easy reach-- kee his eyes on John-- rests his hand on the counter, close-- John sees-— They look at each other-- BONES (cont'd) So-- somebody needs to make somebody pay for something to make themselves feel better, Billy'd be the one to pay. Kill the little piss-pants-- see if it makes a damn day's difference to me, Dad to Dad-- John flinches-- recoils-- Bones picks up his gun-- BONES (cont'd) -- don't tell me about it. Just go do it. (smiles-- deadly) Lord knows I've been patient-- John-- horrified-- Bones-- slow-blinks-- smiles-- points gun at John-- cocks it-- ready to go-- BONES (cont'd) But you think about asking me where he is, I’l1l kill you. You go your way, now.  81. (he laughs) Go with God and a bag-full of guns-- John-- horror-- fear-- he eyes the door-- nods, barely-- Bones-- reaches button on the counter-- pushes it-- the c link gate outside-- starts rolling closed-- John looks at the gate-- just wide enough for John to sti get through-- Bones takes his finger off the button-- the gate stops-- Bones nods at it-- BONES (cont'd) (deadly-- warning) I'm not going to be seeing you again. Good? John backs away-- then turns, past the dogs-- through the gate-- BONES-- watching him-- thinking-- he locks his guns away-

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HUME’S HOUSE - GARAGE - DAY JOHN-- alone in the garage-- he closes the big doors, it dark-- he pulls on an overhead light, pulls his shirt off pulls open a first-aid kit, re-bandages his wounds-- wrap for battle-- he pulls his shirt back on, buttons up-- he looks hardened, now, battle-scarred-- like a warrior-- He opens the duffle-- looks-- the stack of guns-- and: Lays out the array of weapons-- trying to load them, bewildered, at first, trying to see which cartridges go t which-- how to work the safety, he gets it wrong, first, finds it-- he clicks back and forth-- He’s awkward, half-frightened, at first, but-- then-- sta snapping cartridges like a pro-- re-loading, one-handed-- does it over and over-- until he looks half-masterful-- a all the way deadly-- He loads up, for real, clips in the .45, slugs in the Pyt he snaps the breech-gun, shut, double-up-- then-- He clicks all the safety's off, red-dots showing-- He holds the Python out, pointing at a spot on the wall-- see his face, he’s imagining killing someone-- he half- blinks, half-flinches-- but-- breathes-- hardens--  82. Uses the belts, harnesses up weapon after weapon-- the Co the Smith & Wesson-- he figures out a way to sling the sh gun, one of the belts-- he stands there-- he’s ready to k He goes to a laundry basket, pulls out a battered old bla jacket, pulls it on, covering the guns-- then: He climbs into his car-- guns harnessed-- uses the remote open the garage-- and pulls out--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. STREET OUTSIDE HECO’S - NIGHT JOHN pulls up to the tenement-- a wasteland place-- he si there-- takes a deep breath-- gets out--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HECO’S APARTMENT - NIGHT A shitty tenement-- HECO is melting heroin in a spoon, re to shoot up-- watching cartoons-- the door busts in-- JOHN, rushes in at him, gun up-- as Heco jumps up, reache for his gun, he shoots Heco in the leg-- amazed that he h him-- Heco, bleeding, reaches for his gun again-- John grabs him by the throat, shoves Heco's gun away-- ho his gun to Heco’s head-- John-- he wants to shoot Heco-- he's trying not to--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is Billy? Heco-- wincing-- spitting--

dialogues.speaker: HECO
dialogues.text: Fuck you-- John-- smacks the gun-butt right into Heco’s teeth-- we h the crack, his tooth chips-- he spits-- furious-- HECO (cont'd) That’s my tooth-- you asshole-- John-- points the gun back in Heco’s face-- no time for t  83.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (yells) Tell me where he is-- Heco-- hate-- some kind of pride-- but: JOHN (cont'd) Are you ready to die right now? Heco keeps staring-- Heco gives--

dialogues.speaker: HECO
dialogues.text: Fort Point House. By the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: HECO
dialogues.text: The hotel, by the fucking bridge, alright? John sees Heco’s cell-phone, on the table-- he jabs the g at Heco--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (calm-- quiet) Call him. Heco-- hesitates-- John fires a round into the couch, inc from Heco's ear-- stuffing explodes, vaporized thread flo down-- Heco's screaming, holding his ear, deafened-- Heco hesitates-- then picks up his cell, speed-dials-- Jo fires another round into the couch-- JOHN (cont'd) (quiet-- deadly) Put it on speaker. Heco-- hits a button--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. STREET - BILLY’S CORNER - NIGHT BILLY and the OTHERS, on their corner-- SPINK leaning in car-window, palming bills-- Billy's cell rings, he looks-- answers--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (on cell-- speaker) Where are you, you bag of shit? You pipe-lining on me, asshole? HECO-- the gun in his face-- scared-- hurting-- starting ery--

dialogues.speaker: HECO
dialogues.text: Don't go home, Billy-- BILLY-- hearing on speaker-- thrown-- he tenses--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What the fuck-- what the fuck are you talking about, Heco? HECO-- looks at the gun pointed in his face--

dialogues.speaker: HECO
dialogues.text: (starting to cry-- afraid) He says-- you're sentenced, viejo-- BILLY-- hears Heco-- on speaker-- laughs--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: So fucking what? JOHN-- points his gun at Heco’s head--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So this-- BILLY-- hears-- his eyes go wide-- JOHN-- shoots Heco-- dead-- the cell flies, Heco'’s body across the table, scattering his shooting works, spilling liquid heroin-- BILLY-- hears the deafening blast on the phone, jerks the Phone away from his ear--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY-- furious-- starts marching to his car--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (yells) Come on--  85. BILLY, storming ahead, sees: BONES-- in his car-- he’s be watching-- Billy stares-- hating-- BONES slides out-- Billy keeps going for his car-- Bones marches up to Billy fast-- when he’s close--

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: Well, what are we fucking up now, son? You look like you're ina hurry-- Bones-- staring-- BONES (cont'd) You know how much I’ve got to wipe your nose? I’ve got to get some back-bay faggot off my back by telling him he can fucking have you. You think I enjoyed that? (looks at Billy) See son, what you don’t get is, I care about what happens to you-- ‘cause it can hurt me-- Billy-- eyeballing, hating-- dead-eyed-- doesn’t answer-- Bones steps closer-- threatening-- BONES (cont'd) You need some more fucking instruction from me, you piece of piss? Billy-- whips out his gun, swings up his gun and blasts B in the chest-- blood blooms, on his chest-- he falls, dea

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No thanks. Dad. Billy steps over him, takes Bone’s car-keys, leaning to h ear-—- BILLY (cont'd) I’m taking the car. Billy looks at his boys-- heads for the car-- BILLY (cont'd) Let's go home.  BODIE and the OTHERS follow-- they screech out--

dialogues.speaker: CUT
dialogues.text: INT. HECO’S APARTMENT - NIGHT John-- looks at Heco's body-- walks out-- At the door-- John sees car-keys-- he takes them--

dialogues.speaker: CUT
dialogues.text: EXT. STREET OUTSIDE HECO’S - NIGHT Outside-- JOHN looks at his car-- then looks across to muscle-car-- He goes to Heco's car, gets in-- and pulls out, fast-- cur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY and the others march to their cars-- 86.

dialogues.speaker: TO
dialogues.text: Heco’s

dialogues.speaker: TO
dialogues.text: Billy gets into Bones’ car-- they spin out of there, whee smoking-- cur INT./EXT. HECO’S CAR - MOVING - NIGHT JOHN-- driving Heco’s car-- slams through the streets, cornering like a mad-man-- fast-- cur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY and the OTHERS pull up-- it’s a transient hotel, was, now it’s half-deserted, half ruined-- Billy steps stone-faced, staring at the street-- no sign of John--

dialogues.speaker: TO
dialogues.text: or out, They file inside, bristling with guns-- Billy-- watching- waiting-- smiling-- cur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY-- going into a doorway-- looks out a window, watche the street-- eager--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT/EXT. HECO’S CAR - OUTSIDE FORT POINT TENEMENT - NIGHT JOHN pulls up-- sees Billy’s and the muscle-cars parked-- pauses, low-idling, exhaust billows as the engine throats waiting-- John looks at the front door-- he sees SPINK, behind the glass, on post-- gun in hand-- John takes a deep breath-- Spink looks up-- sees Heco’s car, watches, as: John-- steps on the accelerator, gunning straight for SPI behind the glass door-- Spink-- blinded by the headlights-- his eyes go wide-- he raises his gun--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, in Heco’s car, smashes through the front of the building, shattering metal, plaster, glass everywhere-- John-- at the wheel as the car rockets through the entryw rams into Spink and bangs him into the far wall-- smashin Spink, and the car, half through it-- A_huge cloud of plaster dust billows down, peeling paper. wires, pipes-- John-- blinking as debris falls-- The whole building is awake now-- ADDICTS, like dawn of t dead-- SEMI-TRANSIENTS, terrified-- peek out, blinking-- JOHN-- grabs his double-barrelled shotgun-- has to shove all his might to get the bent car door open-- steps out o the car-- feet crunching glass-- John looks at Spink-- dead-- he looks up-- starts climbin the stair to the first floor--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- peering down the dark hall, lit intermittently by pools of light from overhanging lamps we can’t see what’s the darkness at the end-- he makes his way-- DOG steps out of a doorway, he heard the crash-- sees Joh John swings the shotgun to his waist-- Dog's eyes go wide he scrambles for his gun-- he fumbles-- Dog gets his gun up-- aims at John-- John fires off a shot-- it blows off Dog's left leg, at t knee-- Dog drops his gun, screams-- starts to topple over Dog looks_at_ his gun on the floor-- John raises the shotgun to eye-level and squeezes off ano blast-- Dog’s chest explodes, he’s ripped backwards by the force- sliding all the way to the end of the corridor, stopping the entrance of an open apartment door-- John stands, looks at his body-- he breathes-- walks slow away--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the door-- BAGGY-- realizing what’s happening, gra his handgun-- runs to the doorway, shooting blindly out i the corridor-- scared shitless-- JOHN-- takes refuge around a corner-- he clacks open his shotgun-- reloads-- slams it shut-- he takes a breath-- He whips around-- and FIRES-- shattering the doorway and clipping Baggy’s shoulder-- Baggy tears himself away from the door, screaming-- John-- implacable-- rounds the corner, marches calmly dow the corridor, reloading-- his face set-- he’s walking int his own death-- and doesn’t care--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John rips in and chases Baggy through the living-room, exchanging rapid-fire shots-- John-- half-cowering-- stil blinking at the sound of blasts-- but still shooting-- chasing Baggy into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAGGY-- cornered-- John’s coming closer-- Baggy panics, climbs onto the kitchen counter-top to get to the window- JOHN-- steps into the kitchen-- looks up at Baggy--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You want to get it done? Baggy raises his gun-- terrified-- furious-- John-- faste angrier-- half-turns his face away from the blast and blo Baggy right out the kitchen window-- The blast takes Baggy, the window, part of the wall, leav gaping hole of black night, shred of filthy old curtain, blowing-- John-- looks back at the space where Baggy was-- turns-- loads, breathing hard-- in-half-madness-- in death-- He looks out to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out of the apartment-- and is greeted by gunfire He bends double, dodges, scurries down the hall to the en runs up the stairs-- BODIE-- and JAMIE-- guns out-- chase after him-- John-- charging up the stairs-- he fires behind him, runn as fast as he can--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfway up-- Bang-- the railing beside him shatters-- John flinches back as wood debris spray everywhere-- he l over the edge-- and shoots back at Bodie and Jamie, below

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TOP FLOOR - BILLY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT BILLY-- calmly sitting-- loading Bones’ guns-- getting re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- waiting, silent-- then he lets loose a blast of fi again-- below him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BODIE ducks behind a wall, just in time...as the wall obliterates-- JAMIE scampers--— JAMIE-- hiding behind the wall-- re-loading-- he yells to John:

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: (yelling) You know you're going to die in here-- ON THE STAIRS -— JOHN looks down-- he slow-blinks-- nods--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (just loud enough) I know. Bodie hears-- he blinks, half-spooked-- then: BODIE and JAMIE run out, shooting at him-- he fires back- runs up to the second floor--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An abandoned floor-- converted to a crack-house-- JOHN, wary, looking up and down, tries a door-- it opens- goes into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN moves through-- dark-- stripped-- holes the size of doorways punched through the walls, connecting a series o apartments-- maze-like-- John-- gun ready-- looking for Billy-- passes from one ro to the next-- the zapping neon-sign pulsing outside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BODIE and JAMIE arrive on the landing of the second floor split up-- Bodie goes into the door John went through-- Jamie heads the hall to cut John off--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN moves cautiously, he knows Bodie and Jamie are close syringes, vials, pen-cap powder-spoons strewn everywhere- crunching underfoot-- Eerily quiet-- just the neon zap, faint whistling of wind across the face of the building--

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN ALL THREE
dialogues.text: Cat-and-mouse through the maze, one step at a time-- guns ahead of them-- all on guard-- A floorboard creaks under his weight-- he holds his breat Another creak-- around the corner-- John whirls to it, raising his shotgun:  92. He waits a beat-- blinks-- nothing-- BODIE-- a shadow passes over his vision-- he whips around and fires-- -- hitting bare walls-- nothing there-- just the neon-lig dying out-- Bodie-- actually scared-- it’s almost pitch-black--he mov away, along the other wall-- as: John and Jamie are on opposite sides of the same thin wal moving along it-- neither knows the other is there-- John steps on a sheared-out sheet of glass-- it cracks, loudly-- he freezes-- Jamie whips around, hearing-- At the same time, the neon-light zaps back on-- casts Jam shadow onto the adjacent wall-- John sees Jamie’s shadow-- as Jamie raises his shotgun to wall-- John ducks just in time, as the wall above his head explo in a shower of debris-- On one knee, John raises his shotgun-- and fires at the w WE DOLLY INTO THE WALL as a massive hole is blown into it

dialogues.speaker: DOLLYING THROUGH THE HOLE TO THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WALL,
dialogues.text: see: JAMIE-- ripped to shreds by John’s second blast-- he fall forward, flat on his face-- BODIE-- hears-- starts running-- JOHN-- breathing heavily, John tosses his empty shotgun-- pulls out his .45-- cocks it-- He charges to the window-- yanks it open, clambers to the fire-escape-- BY FIRE-ESCAPE -— Bodie catches up to John-- they trade gunfire-- bullets p the walls, smash glass by John-- John ducks, cowers, blinking-- covers his eyes with one a and fires blindly, expecting to die-- but:  93. Bodie’s clipped in the side-- bleeding-- he staggers, rai his gun-- John scrambles up, out of his fire-line--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN clambers upward, checking each window as he passes-- crawls into a window-- into:

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TOP FLOOR - BILLY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT JOHN tumbles through the window, on to the floor, getting his feet, looking up as-- Through the open door-- BILLY out in the hall-- gun up, whirls-- a long, deadly b then--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: There's my dead friend-- looking for your wife and baby-boys? John-- looks at him-- quiet-- certain-- deadly--

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No. I'm here to kill you. Billy-- hate hardening-- he blinks-- In blinding-quick succession: Billy raises his gun to fire-- John-- snaps his gun up, shoots Billy's fingers off-- and half his hand-- Billy, spun by the blast, searing pain, g down temporarily-- a muffled scream lets out of him, half gone hand shaking-- John-- steps closer-- raises his gun, aims at Billy, read shoot, as: From behind, John gets shot in the neck-- John whips around-- sees BODIE, behind him-- he arcs his up, and blows Bodie's head off-- John claps his free hand over his neck-wound-- John turns to face Billy, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy shoots John in the stomach-- John goes down-- but f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a_ shot into Billy’s chest-- John and Billy collapse-- silence-- nothing moves--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then-- John-- rears his head up-- trying to get up, to breathe-- to get to Billy-- he looks across the floor as: Billy-- twitches-- summons up all his strength-- manages get to his feet, stumble toward John-- Billy-- stumbling at John-- barely able to raise and keep gun straight-- but he aims it at John---- John-- gets to his feet-- tries to raise his gun, but-- h bleeding too much-- almost unable to fight anymore, he is going to be quick enough-- Billy still coming-- he squeezes off two shots he braces himself for death, but-- both shots miss _him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's gun clicks-- empty-- he falters-- Billy-- bleedin out-- collapses by John's feet. The two men look at each other-- pure hatred-- Billy-- half-dead-- still trying to crawl at John, to hurt him any way he can-- John-- staggers back, a couple of steps-- John grabs a piece of splintered bannister-- he staggers close to Billy, standing over him-- He raises it-- breathing-- almost-dead-- Billy looks up a him-- John breathes-- JOHN (cont'd) (quietly) Ready? On John-- as John looks down-- hating him-- On Billy's eyes-- he sees what's coming-- as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN-- stumbles out, holding his wounds-- heads for the c as sirens wail, approaching-- He gets in-- and drives away--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HUME’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY JOHN-- stumbles in, through the remains of what was their home, trashed by Billy and his gang-- Finally-- he starts to quietly pick up the debris scatter everywhere-- very quietly making order-- He gathers up a pile of video-tapes, strewn across the fl one catches his eye-- he looks, puts it in the vcr-- it plays: The old video Helen was playing: new year’s eve party ina park, townsfolk gathered-- JOHN, HELEN, BRENDAN, LUCAS-- John’s holding the camera, turning it on Helen, the boys, himself, with them, all goofing-- John stands there, stares at the screen-- everyone’s coun down to midnight, loudly-- the family counts along--

WALLIS appears-- standing in the door-- John turns-- they look at each other-- John holding his hands across his stomach-- falls back in chair, staring the at the party on the screen-- FAMILY, ON TAPE (cont'd)
Wallis looks out, yells-- to COPS, gathered--

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: (yelling) We need an ambulance-- now-- Wallis comes in, sees what John is watching--

dialogues.speaker: FAMILY, ON TAPE
dialogues.text: -- 3-2-1-- Happy New Year-- Wallis looks at John-- the state he’s in-- sympathetic, finally-- On the screen: the crowd cheers-- John turns the camera t catch it as he and Helen kiss, lovingly-- laughing-- the raise their hands in the air, yelling, whooping-- Wallis looks at John--  96.

dialogues.speaker: WALLIS
dialogues.text: If you hang on, we can get you to a hospital-- if you just-- hang on,

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: (yells out-- agitated) An ambulance-- now-- On the screen: as John watches-- a firework display pops lights the sky red, gold, white-- John-- still watching the screen-- Wallis sits in a chair watches with John-- We push in on the video-- the crowd starts singing Auld L Syne-- John, Helen, Lucas, Bren, all laughing, all happy, singing-- FADE OUT.
